intro: Palicourea paulina, commonly known as the pink-flowered piper, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of showy, pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Palicourea paulina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
